intro: Cephalostemon affinis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cephalostemon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers, which are usually white or pale blue, bloom in clusters and attract various pollinators.
